creditline: Gift of Tamara and Michael Root
description: rectangular high-profile tile with spoon form at center; white glaze with eggshell cracking over entire surface; slightly tilted 3D spoon with bowl near center and handle off edge towards top
text: This minimalist tile—a spoon rising from its surface—is one of many explorations of impressions in Kivivirta’s mostly two-dimensional tile work. It is a notable example of how her tiles provide interest and variety for interiors, following in the artistic tile traditions of the Netherlands in the 1600s to 1700s and Britain in the 1800s.
title: Spoon Tile
